data.question: What is the chemical formula of the empty single-crystal host of rhodium(ii) benzoate pyrazine?
At what temperature does the crystal structure of 1 undergo a phase transition in a CO2 atmosphere?
True or False: The crystal structure of 1 at 20 8C has channel structures sufficient to hold guest molecules.
What is the space group of the crystal structure of 1 in the absence of CO2 at -180 8C?
How many CO2 molecules per Rh2 unit does the crystal structure contain at -80 8C according to X-ray diffraction data?
True or False: The BET surface area of the crystal in a CO2 atmosphere is larger than when N2 gas is adsorbed at 77 K.
What is the estimated Brunauer–Emmett–Teller (BET) surface area of the crystal in a CO2 atmosphere?
True or False: The crystal transformation from an empty single crystal to an inclusion single crystal is irreversible.
What is the estimated value of the isosteric heat of adsorption (DHiso) for CO2 during cooling?
True or False: The crystal can include more than one CO2 molecule per Rh2 unit under a saturation condition.
What happens to the crystal structure of 1 when cooled in a CO2 atmosphere?
data.answer: It undergoes a phase transition to a new structure adopting the triclinic space group P1¯.

data.question: True or False: The crystal structure of 1 can smoothly adsorb N2 gas at 77 K.
What is the maximum number of CO2 molecules per Rh2 unit that the inclusion crystal can contain?
True or False: The crystal structure of 1 at 20 8C and -60 8C contains the same amount of CO2 molecules per Rh2 unit.
What is the BET surface area of the crystal when N2 gas is adsorbed at 77 K?
How does the crystal structure of 1 change under conditions where CO2 is absent?
data.answer: The space-group symmetry changes from C2/m to C2/c on cooling to -180 8C.

data.question: True or False: The crystal structure of 1 can adsorb CO2 gas through the narrow gaps at the corners of the cages.
What is the critical quantity of adsorbed CO2 estimated to be at a significant transition point close to -5 8C?
data.answer: One CO2 molecule per Rh2 unit

data.question: What is the function of the simultaneous powder X-ray diffraction (XRD) and differential scanning calorimetry (DSC) measurements?
data.answer: To observe changes in the diffraction pattern of 1 and detect structural rearrangements.

data.question: True or False: The crystal structure of 1 at -180 8C in a CO2 atmosphere has a channel structure with a narrow neck too narrow for atmospheric gas to be adsorbed.
